briefdescription.para: Gets the diagnostic carried by this exception.

briefdescription.para: Gets the error object associated with this exception.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the XQuery "applied at" location has been set.

simplesect.para: Returns true only if the "applied at" location has been set.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the XQuery data location has been set.

simplesect.para: Returns true only if the data location has been set.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether the XQuery source-code location has been set.

simplesect.para: Returns true only if said has been set.

parameterdescription.para: The UserException to assign from.

simplesect.para: Returns *this.

briefdescription.para: Throws itself polymorphically; see http://www.parashift.com/c++-faq-lite/exceptions.html#faq-17.16.

simplesect.para: Returns said stack trace.

briefdescription.para: Gets the XQuery stack trace, if any.

simplesect.para: Returns said stack trace.

briefdescription.para: Gets the C++ source-code file name whence this exception was raised.

simplesect.para: Returns said file name.

briefdescription.para: Gets the C++ source-code line number whence this exception was raised.

simplesect.para: Returns said line number.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current print_format associated with the given ostream.

parameterdescription.para: The ostream to get the print_format of.

simplesect.para: Returns said print_format.

briefdescription.para: Gets whether XQuery stack traces will be included when XQueryExceptions are printed to the given ostream.

parameterdescription.para: The ostream.

simplesect.para: Returns true only if stack traces will be included.

briefdescription.para: Sets the print_format of the given ostream.

The print_format value.

briefdescription.para: Sets whether XQuery stack traces will be included when XQueryExceptions are printed to the given ostream.

parameterdescription.para: The ostream to affect.
If true, stack traces will be included.

briefdescription.para: A UserException is-an XQueryException for errors raised via fn:error().
